sources.title: Wiretapper
sources.description: Title: Wiretapper Summary: An army ex-con electronics engineer, sells his skills to a violent crime boss for big money, as his loving Christian wife begs him to stop. Directed by: Dick Ross Actors: Bill Williams, Georgia Lee, Douglas Kennedy Production Company: Great Commission Films Release Date: 10 August 1955 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Jin Vaus, Jr., U.S. Army electronics expert, is sentenced to a stockade term for unauthorized use of government equipment. He keeps it a secret from his fianc√©e, Alice, and pretends he has been overseas when he is discharged, and they are married.. He opens an electrical engineering company and becomes involved with a gangster mob headed by Charles Rumsden. She begs him to quit but he is useful to the crooks, discovering wiretaps, setting up alarm systems and even saving a hoodlum's life by disconnecting a time bomb. Gang-member Tony urges Jim to invent a device that could tap lines carrying race results and delay them so they could make some big money on post-race betting. After Tony is killed by a fellow mobster, Alice persuades Jim to attend a tent meeting held by evangelist Billy Graham. Graham's sermon and words so inspire Jim that he gives up his criminal activities.

sources.title: Wiretapper (1955) BILL WILLIAMSüçï EVANGELICAL CRIME
sources.description:
Movie Class by PizzaFLIX: James Vaus had a spiritual awakening in 1949 while attending Billy Graham's Los Angeles Crusade, which led to his story being produced by Great Commission Films, a unit within Graham's evangelical ministry.

Stars: Bill Williams, Georgia Lee, Bill Graham
Director: Dick Ross

The fascinating story of an electronics expert who discovered a way to delay horse race results for the Mickey Cohen syndicate in Los Angeles! Based on the autobiography by Jim Vaus "Why I Quit Syndicated Crime." With a cinematic score by Ralph Carmichael!

sources.title: Wiretapper (1955) TRUE CRIME
sources.description:
Stars: Bill Williams, Georgia Lee, Douglas Kennedy

He opens an electrical engineering company and becomes involved with a gangster mob headed by Charles Rumsden. She begs him to quit but he is useful to the crooks, discovering wiretaps, setting up alarm systems and even saving a hoodlum's life by disconnecting a time bomb. After Tony is killed by a fellow mobster, Alice persuades Jim to attend a tent meeting held by evangelist Billy Graham.
